author: dcspark
title: Milkomeda DAO Hackathon
description: Muchos usuarios de Cardano no se dan cuenta de que pueden lanzar su DAO en Milkomeda utilizando herramientas maduras

f6_assessments.q0: Offering more elaborate tooling to DAOs launched on Cardano would certainly incentivise companies or projects who want to start one, to come and verify all the benefits of the Cardano blockchain. As such, I find this proposal could have a potential big and positive impact on the ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposers have provided enough information regarding their prior experience and I have no doubt after reading their backgrounds that they will successfully be able to implement it. The budget is not very detailed, but since the majority of the funds will be used as prizes in the hackathon, I don't see it as a deficiency.
f6_assessments.q2: While some additional information regarding their plan for the hackathon would have better helped in assessing the succes of their proposal, the nature of this online event, the Milkomeda DAO Hackathon, is pretty straight forward, teams will participate in the event, and some of them will be receiving prizes. Considering the team's abilities, I don't find this lack of information as having too much of a negative impact on their success.

f6_assessments.q0: This team proposes to host a virtual hackathon on how to build a DAO structures on Cardano with Milkomeda. The challenge is asking for solution to make Cardano the go-to-blockchain for DAOs. On a high level the proposal is within the challenge settings. However, it could be more clear on how this hackathon is connected to the goal of this challenge and also what impact to Cardano in general could be expected.
f6_assessments.q1: About feasibility there are not many information. Where do you get the participants from. It would be helpful to see a more detailed plan about the hackathon itself. The goal of it is clear. But how will the goal be reached. The team itself has proven its ability to deliver projects inside Cardano for many years and I trust them to deliver this proposal. The requested funds are meant to be the prize pool for the hackathon. It would be good to know the scope of the hackathon to assess if the amount is reasonable or not.
f6_assessments.q2: It is roughly mentioned when the Hackathon will take place. Besides that not many details are provided to audit the progress and success of this proposal. Adding some more information would help the community to track the implementation of this proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal addresses the main objectives of the challenge, by proposing a host a virtual hackathon for individuals & companies that want to start a DAO and share knowledge about Cardano & Ethereum.  In my opinion the team's idea has potential to accelerate the adoption of DAO outside blockchain community as well as improving Cardano DAO ecosystem. The hackathon could bring fresh DAO implementation idea from individual developers or companies and will be a very valuable for the development of Cardano ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: As ex-Emurgo and ex-IOHK employees, team members have relevant experience and significant network in the Cardano development that could boost the likelihood of project success. However, they did'nt provide details about how to execute the project. The team requested a budget without detail on how the money will be spend or allocated. There is no roadmap, budget breakdown, or timeline for the execution of this project in the proposal. My suggestion for the team is to complete the proposal with more information and details.
f6_assessments.q2: There are no clear success metrics or KPI in the proposal. The team does not provide deliverables, roadmap, or detailed plan on how to execute the project and there is no budget breakdown in the proposal. Team does not mention where they will publish the progress of project execution making it difficult to trace, monitor, or audit the project. My suggestion for the team is to update the proposal with more information and details including deliverables, goals, KPI, roadmap, detailed execution plan, and budget breakdown.

f6_assessments.q0: Hackathon is one of the programs to help develop projects and find potential developers that I like very much in blockchains, companies and projects on other platforms. It can create a strong wave of development, and encourage people to contribute and build great products. But I think for more folks that are unfamiliar with tooling for DAOs that more explanation to highlight why it's important would be helpful to getting your through the CA period and to voters with a fighting chance. IA vast majority of voters and/or CAs might not have the insight to understand how important this is at the current maturity level of SC in Cardano?
f6_assessments.q1:
"The team is composed of well known ex-Emurgo and ex-IOHK employees who have been building the Cardano ecosystem for the past several years.
They also work in dcSpark which is a crypto ecosystem builder company. dcSpark was founded by three former EMURGO members who have been deeply involved in the Cardano ecosystem for years
But I have not seen any proof that the experiences proposed by the proposer are true, so I still have doubts about the veracity of these personal experiences.
Besides, I have seen that the proposal has solutions to implement, but the plan, roadmap, and key metrics have not been given, reducing the feasibility of the proposal.
"
f6_assessments.q2: As mentioned in the other sections, there is limited information about what this plan is concretely going to deliver and therefore would make it almost impossible to know what success measures or any other metrics could be use to track and follow the progress of this proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is about hosting a virtual hackathon for individuals & companies that want to start a DAO and share knowledge about Cardano & Ethereum. This idea is very meaningful. The problem is clear, in line with the given challenge, however, the proposed solution is still very abstract [no roadmap, budget breakdown, KPIs, ...]. Therefore, based on the information given, I do not agree with the impact of this proposal, I can rate with a score of 2
f6_assessments.q1: This team profile is provided and is descriptive enough to understand, with appropriate skills and experience to perform, along with references/evidence (https://dcspark.gitbook.io/milkomeda/details/team) to verify. So the team's track record convinces me of its feasibility, however, the plan did not. Budget breakdown with a total budget only, without any milestone. In addition, the risk is not identified. Therefore, based on the given information, I am neutral on the feasibility of this proposal, I can rate it with a score of 3.
f6_assessments.q2: Team profiles are provided and are descriptive enough to understand with references/evidence (documents/links, ...) for verification. My advice is: for a better understanding of the plan, the proposer should consider adding the missing information: (1) Budget allocation (with explanation for each item); (2) Roadmap (with KPIs / Metrics); (3) Risk/Challenge Analysis Based on the information given, I disagree with the auditability of this proposal, I can rate it with a score of 2

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal is suggesting to run a hackathon focussed on DAOs where the company dcSpark can help support other projects due to their own experience of launching a DAO in the coming months. There is currently a serious lack of DAO tooling in the community that makes it difficult for projects to operate in an autonomous way that protects core team members and their community when working on the different ecosystem projects. If the hackathon helps lead to more tooling for DAOs that the community can use this presents a large opportunity to create a high impact for the ecosystem. 

To give this a better rating it would have been great to see more information on the DAO that dcSpark are working on and more thoughts on this area or some comparisons between existing solutions in either EVM environments or Cardano.
f6_assessments.q1: The team behind the proposal are a well known community company dcSpark. There is a number of completed proposals in their history with funding from Catalyst and have worked closely with IOG and Emurgo in their professional history. The budget is reasonable as only a maximum of 10% of the funds will be used for the event and the rest for attendees to help drive more interest and solutions to the event. There is a high chance that this proposal is both feasible and will be executed as outlined.
f6_assessments.q2: A basic outline for a roadmap is provided stating first half of 2022. No KPIs or success objectives are provided. Adding a simple high attendance to the event and stating an attendance number for a KPI may not be the most valuable metric to state however what could have been added is some success criteria for how dcSpark want to interact with the attendees and what support they can offer. It would have been great to know who from dcSpark exactly would be involved with the event and what time they would be able to allocate to the event itself and post event. A large part of the value that could be audited from this event is how attendees got to benefit from the education that the dcSpark team can provide - measuring that could be a great way to really audit and verify the impact provided.

solution: Organizaremos un hackathon virtual para personas y empresas que quieran crear una DAO y compartir nuestros conocimientos sobre Cardano y Ethereum
experience: Nuestro equipo está compuesto por conocidos ex empleados de Emurgo y ex empleados de IOHK que han estado construyendo el ecosistema de Cardano durante los últimos años
